text: green garlic season is short so make a
compound butter and then you can keep it
on hand all summer long green garlic is
just immature garlic imagine this is
growing in the ground this is the bulb
right and as it grows this bulb gets
fatter but if you harvest it early what
you get is this very mild tender kind of
herbal tasting garlic it's very fresh
you just want to strip it like a
scallion and only use the tender white
inner part a compound butter is just
softened butter that you add flavorful
things to in this case I'm adding minced
green garlic chives salt and pepper and
then some Parmesan cheese you want the
butter to be so soft that when you stick
your finger right in there it just goes
right through
if you freeze the compound butter in an
ice cube tray then you can just pull out
a small amount whenever you want to just
add it to rice or pasta or make crostini
I want the bread to be very dense so
that there aren't a lot of big holes in
it and then the butter doesn't drip
through and then you don't lose all of
that butter
I broke the bread twice the first time
gets the edges nice and toasty so that
when I rub mature garlic on them you
have something that it can rub against a
rough surface for it to catch on then I
spread the butter on it or not of butter
I put it back in the broiler and then in
that broiling time the Parmesan cheese
melts and Browns and then the whole
thing just gets so delicious I use
avocado to tough this crostini but you
could use whatever you want
ricotta anchovies sardines whatever
makes you happy
